parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 2nd Person Plural
str2: From a derivative of mneme; to exercise memory, i.e. Recollect; by implication, to punish; also to rehearse.
A brother, member of the same religious community, especially a fellow-Christian. A brother near or remote.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 1st Person Plural
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.
From kopto; a cut, i.e. toil, literally or figuratively; by implication, pains.
Wearisome labor, toil, hardship. From the base of mogis; toil, i.e. sadness.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Middle or Passive - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: To work, trade, perform, do, practice, commit, acquire by labor.
The night, night-time. A primary word; 'night'.
A day, the period from sunrise to sunset.
To, towards, with. A strengthened form of pro; a preposition of direction; forward to, i.e. Toward.

word: we would not be a burden
str2: To put a burden on, be burdensome. From epi and bareo; to be heavy upon, i.e. to be expensive to; figuratively, to be severe towards.

parse: Interrogative / Indefinite Pronoun - Accusative Masculine Singular
str2: Any one, some one, a certain one or thing. An enclitic indefinite pronoun; some or any person or object.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 1st Person Plural
str2: To proclaim, herald, preach. Of uncertain affinity; to herald, especially divine truth.
A primary preposition; to or into, of place, time, or purpose; also in adverbial phrases.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative 2nd Person Plural
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
From the same as euaggelizo; a good message, i.e. The gospel.
A deity, especially the supreme Divinity; figuratively, a magistrate; by Hebraism, very.
